meanings.definition: A literary work of low quality produced quickly for profit.
meanings.sent1: The author's latest novel was just a potboil, lacking depth or originality.
meanings.sent2: Many readers enjoy a potboil for light entertainment without much substance.
meanings.sent3: The book club members chuckled at the potboil, recognizing its predictable plot twists.
meanings.sent4: Her writing style was like a potboil, churning out stories without much thought.
meanings.sent5: The potboil was forgotten as quickly as it was read, leaving no lasting impression.

meanings.definition: To write or create in a hurried or formulaic manner.
meanings.sent1: She had to potboil the article to meet the deadline, sacrificing depth for speed.
meanings.sent2: The author decided to potboil the sequel, focusing on quantity over quality.
meanings.sent3: He would often potboil his essays, resulting in repetitive and uninspired writing.
meanings.sent4: The playwright had to potboil the script for the last-minute performance, losing its original charm.
meanings.sent5: In a rush, she would potboil her ideas onto paper, hoping to capture the essence quickly.
